phrases: Year - Class Year 3 Class 2 Name Mashiro Moritaka
I was sure you would come back for this.
So, I was waiting for you.
What the hell is he planning?
Work with me and become a mangaka.
II'm going to be drawing the art, and he is doing the stories.
Then I am sure you will make it!
S-So if our manga gets turned into an anime,
we will reserve the role of heroine for you or something...
I will become a seiyuu and appear on your anime.
Note: A Seiyuu is a Japanese voice actor.
So if that dream comes true, please marry me!
I could not sleep a wink.
How long do you plan on staying in your pajamas?
Please hurry up and get ready.
Honestly, cannot you be polite and say Yes, Mom.?
So if that dream comes true, please marry me!
If our dreams come true... marry...
He got me worked up, and I blurted out that I would become a mangaka, but...
Moritaka, Takagi-kun is here to see you!
Please do not call me Saikou or suddenly show up to meet me in the morning like this.
Come on, I will call you Saikou and you can call me Shuuto.
Note: The name Moritaka uses the same kanji as Saikou (), meaning the best.
and an Akito going by Shuuto are a bit different.
The kanji for Akito () can also be pronounced Shuuto, as in the English shoot.
The name Shuuto gives off a cool soccer image.
Saikou sounds like I am being made fun of.
Then I am going to call you Shuujin.
Shuujin is a Japanese word for prisoner.
It is fine, is not it?
Akito can be read that way too, cannot it?
Your uncle died three years ago, right?
Did you check up on it?
But they did not know he was the mangaka, Kawaguchi Tarou.
It is a pen name after all.
His real name was Mashiro Nobuhiro.
Seems like it just said Mangaka dies in the corner of some newspaper.
If a mangaka cannot get serialized, they are just a NEET.
Note: NEET stands for Not in Education, Employment or Training
After being a NEET for seven years in a row, it would be no surprise that you wanted to die.
My parents said he died because he was overworked,
but he barely had any work for seven years, right?
So, do you want to give up on being a mangaka?
Even if you quit, I am going to do it.
I am going to do it too!
Teamed up with you, we will be the top mangakas in Japan!
Like I said, I have not decided if I am teaming up with you or not.
I am the one who inspired you to do it in the first place, are not I?
It was not you, it was Azuki.
But you have my thanks, cupid Shuujin-kun.
Even so, Saikou, let us work together eh?
I will not lose to you on today's test.
Even the results for the first term of third year will have a big impact on our high school applications.
Have you decided which high school to go to?
So these two are the top of our grade?
Yesterday, I just gave up and went to sleep.
I got my skin all shiny for nothing.
I could not get much studying done yesterday either.
You always get good scores anyhow, Miho.
At least try not to spell your name wrong.
She is the same as always.
Even after something like what happened last night...
I do not feel so good, could I rest in the infirmary until second period?
Your complexion certainly does not look good.
You can take a retest, if you want.
I finished half, this much will be fine.
Are you okay to go on your own?
I spent all last night studying and now I feel dizzy.
Well, I guess it is all right then...
Hey now, everybody concentrate on your tests!
Sorry, I did not get enough sleep.
I will just be borrowing a bed for a bit.
You really do not look it.
I am so dizzy I feel like I am going to throw up, I have got a migraine...
You did not sleep last night, right?
Do you have a fever or something?
It was kind of suffocating, being in that classroom.
It is like my chest got all tight when I was in the same room as Azuki...
Has there been any progress since then?
Did you guys at least exchange email addresses?
If you are well enough to talk, then please go back to your classroom!
Why did you two come here?
I will ask for Azuki's address for you.
I would feel pretty pathetic if you did that.
But you cannot ask her yourself, right?
If I could talk to her that easily, I would not be stressing over this.
You really do like Azuki, do not you?
I like people like you two, Saikou.
You are as creepy as ever.
Look at other people who are going out.
They are being lovey dovey without caring where they are,
they prattle on about how proud they are to be dating and stuff...
They are all just like that.
Compared to them, I like people who get choked up from just being in the same classroom way better.
Like I said, what good does it do me to be liked by you?
But now it is really sealed that we will team up.
Because I am the only one who knows that you like Azuki.
So I am the only one who you can talk to about your love life.
We are each other's closest friends.
So let us combine our skills in both love and manga and give it everything we have got!
Love is love, manga is manga.
Anyway, are you okay with not going back?
I already finished the test flawlessly, full marks without a doubt.
I really do not get you.
You have got your sights set on being a mangaka, so why are you studying so hard?
You do not need an academic background for it.
Even I am not a hundred percent sure I can make it.
That is a wise way to live.
Do you see everyone in the class as idiots?
Do you think you are the smartest one in the class?
Why such an unpleasant question all of a sudden?!
You think that unless you are smart, you cannot become one, do not you?
To be a mangaka, you need brains and good sense.
But I do not think you can say being good at studying equals being smart.
It is only been two months since we joined the same class, Saikou,
That is why I asked you.
If it were only your drawings that were good, I would not have asked you.
As for that Do you see everyone in the class as idiots?
It is because you see everyone you asked it as idiots themselves, right?
Or rather, I think she is clever.
She is cute, but without standing out in an odd way.
She genuinely behaves with grace, you know?
It is because she is doing it without thinking.
I think she is much cleverer than me, who can just study well.
She is even blessed in her own environment and household, that Azuki.
That is why she is not greedy.
Azuki's charm comes from her good family and wealth of spirit,
and she has a dignity born of her intelligence, do not you think?
Anyway, you sure are praising her a lot.
I may be praising her, but you are not getting jealous or impatient.
It is because you are smart.
Man, good parents, a good house, a good face,
from the moment we are born, there is plenty of stuff that makes everyone different.
But in the end, past all that, the stupid ones who dream,
but are smart enough not to get lost in their dreams, are the ones who can get to the top.
Anyway, from this point onwards, we have got to keep giving it all we have got.
I think I might team up with you after all.
Your way of thinking is sort of similar to mine,
and I think a story made by you would be interesting.
Then let us both do our best together!
I just mean that if you write a name that is interesting,
I will draw the pictures for it.
Do you think you can handle taking the next exam?
I have been thinking about your uncle's suicide, like you said.
Do you think your parents would be against you becoming a mangaka?
With something like that having happened to a relative,
it would not be that strange for them to be opposed to it.
It is certainly true that since Uncle died like that.
They will definitely be against the idea.
When I get home, I will convince them.
Like with Kyojin no Hoshi's Hoshi Ittetsu
parents are the first hurdle for their kids to overcome.
If there is something I want or something I need to discuss,
Then, when I am not around, my mom tells my dad.
Then if my dad is against it, she will tell me later.
If no objections are made, then that means it is okay and goes through.
In other words, my dad and I have almost never had a serious talk.
No, I will when it is done.
You have not even said I am home yet.
I have got something I need to talk about.
What do you need to discuss?
Please hurry up and say it.
I am going to be a mangaka.
That sure was a fast reply.
I will go to high school and college, like normal.
If nothing comes of it by the time I am out of college, I will give it up.
By that you mean you will settle for any old school and just draw manga, right?
Even your uncle had his debut when he was in college.
If I let you do this here, you would just be doing the same thing as him.
I knew there would be a comparison to Uncle.
Forget about manga and concentrate on your studies.
You do not know for sure that I would go down the same path that Uncle did.
There is definitely no reason to think I would kill myself!
Do you think your uncle committed suicide?!
He was not selling anymore, and in order to get selling again, he worked too hard...
I meant that to draw until you die is like suicide, in a way...
I am sure your father would not allow it either.
Please at least talk with Dad about it.
Dad still has not come home yet.
Though I said it in the spur of the moment, I have always wanted to be a mangaka...
As he kept drawing he would get more disheveled.
He may not have been able to sell in the end,
and he may be gone now,
but this fascinating manga is still here.
I think, after all, no matter what I am told,
I am going to become a mangaka.
Must mean Dad gave a fast reply too...
Men have their dreams that women cannot understand.
He is the one who lost a son to manga, so we have to let him know.
can I come in for a second?
I am going to be a mangaka.
The keys to your uncle's room.
Nobihiro's room, his workplace has been left the same as it was when he died.
No, I have not decided if I want to become a mangaka for sure.
It is still ten years too early to have a workplace...
You will not be using it seriously for a long time,
but there is nothing wrong with being prepared ahead of time.
Also, that room is packed with things you need to become a mangaka, is not it?
Is it all right if I go over there now?
It is past ten already and you have a test tomorrow
Thank you, I am going to get ready!
Moritaka has changed, has not he?
I was really worried that he would end up a failure,
but he is fine like this.
Just seeing Uncle's manuscripts will be enough.
Did your parents give you permission?
I will show you a name, so come.
I got the workplace that my uncle left after he died!
D-Do you mean they gave it to you when you said you were going to be a mangaka?
I am heading towards the northern Yakusa Station.
I am leaving right now, wait for me at the station.
Let us go to Uncle's workplace!
What is left behind there are passionate thoughts and a harsh reality.
What supports dreams are love and romance!
